bugs.title: CVE-2023-20898 salt: Git Providers can read from the wrong environment [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-20898 salt: Git Providers can read from the wrong environment [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-20898 salt: Git Providers can read from the wrong environment

long_desc.thetext:
Git Providers can read from the wrong environment because they get the same cache directory base name in Salt masters prior to 3005.2 or 3006.2. Anything that uses Git Providers with different environments can get garbage data or the wrong data, which can lead to wrongful data disclosure, wrongful executions, data corruption and/or crash.


https://saltproject.io/security-announcements/2023-08-10-advisory/

Created salt tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2237512]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2237511

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2237511,2237512

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new
FEDORA-2023-ac1aa963e4 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 37. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2023-ac1aa963e4
FEDORA-EPEL-2023-d9153eda95 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 9. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2023-d9153eda95

FEDORA-EPEL-2023-d9153eda95 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 9 testing repository.

You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2023-d9153eda95

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-2023-ac1aa963e4 has been pushed to the Fedora 37 testing repository.
Soon you'll be able to install the update with the following command:
`sudo dnf upgrade --enablerepo=updates-testing --refresh --advisory=FEDORA-2023-ac1aa963e4`
You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2023-ac1aa963e4

See also https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for more information on how to test updates.

FEDORA-EPEL-2023-d9153eda95 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 9 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

FEDORA-2023-ac1aa963e4 has been pushed to the Fedora 37 stable repository.
If problem still persists, please make note of it in this bug report.

bugs.title: CVE-2023-20897 salt: DOS in minion return [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-20897 salt: DOS in minion return [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-20897 salt: DOS in minion return

long_desc.thetext:
Salt masters prior to 3005.2 or 3006.2 contain a DOS in minion return. After receiving several bad packets on the request server equal to the number of worker threads, the master will become unresponsive to return requests until restarted.


https://saltproject.io/security-announcements/2023-08-10-advisory/

Created salt tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2237514]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2237513

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2237513,2237514

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======
